intro: Saussurea acroura, commonly known as the Tibetan safflower, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas and Central Asia. It features a robust, woody root system and a tall, branched stem that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces yellow to orange flower heads, which are composed of numerous small florets arranged in a composite structure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with dense, white hairs, adapted to the cold, arid environments it inhabits. Saussurea acroura is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
